newsitem.title: UK: GDR REPORT-India sees profit taking after rally.
newsitem.headline: GDR REPORT-India sees profit taking after rally.

text.p: Indian global depositary receipts (GDRs) saw some profit taking after Monday's Reserve Bank of India-inspired rally as the local markets resumed trading after a holiday for a Hindu festival.
"There was not a great deal of activity after yesterday and a few stocks were down," said a trader.
The HSBC James Capel Indian GDR index closed down 0.37 points, 0.57 percent, at 65.22 points, with the premium over the local market at 13.87 percent compared with yesterday's 17.89 percent.
The Bombay Stock Exchange 30-share index ended 96.92 points or 3.10 percent higher from Friday's close at 3,227.13, after hitting an intraday high of 3,235.26.

On Saturday, the central bank cut cash reserve requirements, which has the effect of increasing liquidity in India's economy and stock market. This will release $2.4 billion in to the country's banking system.
The Capel index had rallied 6.46 percent on Monday and today, some stocks were a little weaker.
The Capel Korea GDR Index ended down 1.19 points, 1.63 percent, at 71.74 points, a premium of 28.84 percent over the local market after the
Korea Composite Index fell down 1.61 percent or 13.40 points to 819.22.
The Capel Taiwan GDR Index ended off 0.60 points, 0.67 percent, at 88.54 points, a premium of 2.91 percent after the Taiwan Weighted Index fell 14.85 points or 0.23 percent to 6,426.30.
